comments.text:

two different styles. 

Lawrence Mystique is more emotionally conflicted/anti-hero 

Rebecca is more action/silent orientated who is mainly evil throughout.

Personally I prefer Lawrence Mystique because I could contact her character 
more because I could understand the reasoning and terrible decisions behind 
her drastic actions. Its kinda isn't fair two compare different Mystique's 
because each ones very different. Lawrence Mystique is more of the 
beginning phase who she will become in the future X-Men films.

comments.text:
+Jake Markham That's thing about business your not going to make everybody 
happy. Your going to make a X-Men movie that will either please the X-Men 
fans (such as me) or your going to have make a movie that have a wider 
audience appeal. Movies want to make a X-Men movie that have a birder 
audience appeal because comic book fans only make 1% of the audience. 
Beside I doubt Mystique won't have a big rule in this X-Men Apocalypse but 
just have a reasonable  role in this movie as a side villain. We also tend 
to forget she has  also have a role in Apocalypse  comic story lines so 
having her make sense. This movie is still will be the the origin of the 
X-Men team. But you have to be careful because not every character isn't 
going to have screen time or the movie will be tied down to subplots that 
average movie going audience will probably complain not to care about 
especially unknown characters there not familiarize with. It sucks because 
I know people that didn't care for First Class all because they didn't have 
enough "Wolverine" and may people enjoy Wolverine Origins, The Wolverine or 
Days of Future Past all because Wolverine was the main lead in the movie.

Kinberg recently said that the time travel events would send ripples 
through X1, 2, and even 3, and the events of the Wolverine films, so it 
seems that 3 and Origins still count in some capacity.

That said, Apocalypse might be another time jump film, so I imagine they 
could have an Age of Apocalypse scenario, where the original cast (who are 
supposed to be included) would face a dark future, and Angel would be 
included among the Horseman.

I actually think Apocalypse might be split into two films, just to capture 
the grandiose nature of Apocalypse himself!

top_comment.text:
First off I still don't get this Jenifer Lawrence hoopla, I mean she's not 
even the best Mystique that honour still belongs to Rebecca Romijn, 
particularly in X-Men and X2. Second I want more focus on on the likes of 
Cyclops, Jean, Storm, Angel and Rogue. I know Jean had a big role in the 
original trilogy but in the end she was still playing second fiddle to 
Wolverine.

I'd like to see other characters back stories fleshed out more, and in all 
honesty it makes it hard for the franchise to grow when you constantly 
focus on one or two characters all the time. One thing that I have always 
loved about the X-Men be it in cartoons or comics is that each member is 
equally important, something the movies have failed at.﻿

because all her life she was pretending something that she will never be

of Future Past she developed more into character that accept of who she 
really was. Mystique developed into more of  a violent/stubborn and cold 
hearted person compare to the events of  First Class. To be honest I think 
the only reason people don't like Jennifer Lawrence as Mystique because

past. Blink didn't do much or say much in the US version. but her being in 
the movie lets her do press and interviews on chinese shows to get people 
in China to go see it.
comments.author: rurutu M

comments.text:
+rurutu M I find it shocking that in this day and age there are still 
quotas, and in all things comic book movies. Why must there be certain 
number of black characters?
comments.author: TheoKabala89

comments.text:
+Darnell Banks Marvel might put Black Panther on hold if they are giving 
War Machine and Falcon more screentime in the coming movies for black 
characters. They are going for the Asian audiences like most summer 
blockbusters are. they will show more Asian characters like in IM3, Big 
Hero 6, Dr Strange has a lot of Asian aspects and mysticism.
comments.author: rurutu M

comments.text:
By first I meant, first one in the comics, Black Panther debuted in 1966 
and Blade showed up in 1973.
comments.author: Darnell Banks

comments.text:
+Darnell Banks Wesley Snipes already claimed the first black superhero with 
Blade.
comments.author: rurutu M

comments.text:
+rurutu M actually he lost to mccaughey, and he hasn't fallen off the map 
he's just gone back to smaller, independent films like half a yellow sun 
which came out this year.
comments.author: TheoKabala89

comments.text:
I think he could be lured in with an impressive script and with the allure 
of a chance to play the first black superhero in comics.
comments.author: Darnell Banks

comments.text:
+Darnell Banks That guy got his Oscar and fell off the map like Jared Leto. 
It would be great to see him in another movie with Joss Whedon but he might 
not be into the whole superhero blockbuster thing. Cause most of the work 
in these Marvel/DC movies is 2 months of promotions and fan events
comments.author: rurutu M

comments.text: Chiwetel Ejiofor
comments.author: Darnell Banks

comments.text:
nah, i'm still holding out for another blade movie staring wesley. i think 
the success of his original trilogy puts marvel's lack of focus on black 
superheroes to shame.
comments.author: TheoKabala89

comments.text:
doesn't really matter, Black Panther is always wearing his mask like 
Spiderman. The actor playing him isn't all that important. I don't think 
Marvel will do a Black Panther movie anytime soon. He looks way too much 
like Batman the general public will just think of him as a black Batman.
comments.author: rurutu M

comments.text:
+TheoKabala89 I'm thinking Weasly Snipes would be the perfect Jhon Stewart. 
I really want Idres Elba as Martian Manhunter.
comments.author: boaman5435

comments.text:
+stridin my thoughts exactly, particularly the JL animated series John 
Stewart.
comments.author: TheoKabala89

comments.text: How about Wesley Snipes?
comments.author: BlackMasamune X

comments.text:
+TheoKabala89  Agreed, If you saw his character in Pacific Rim. You 
basically saw the great John Stewart.
comments.author: stridin

comments.text:
+anthony leach i would prefer if "the client" and "enemy of the state" were 
sequels. we need a first movie that will let the general audience get use 
to the character of t'challa first.
comments.author: sulti1274

comments.text:
Black Panther is the superhero who got me into comics.  The two things i 
would want is them being a good actor as well as martial artist.  I would 
love it if 'Enmy of the State' and 'The Client' were made into one movie.
comments.author: anthony leach

comments.text: +boaman5435 to me Idris Elba would be a better John Stewart than T'Chala.
comments.author: TheoKabala89

comments.text: +boaman5435 Damn You Arrow i forgot he was bronze tigger
comments.author: anthony leach

comments.text:
+boaman5435
i didnt know Michael Jai White was in arrow. hell i would had check it out. 
thanks for the info.
comments.author: mjxbox

top_comment.text:
I'd fancy a Mystique movie but, in all honesty I don't think it would be 
well received or even perhaps even well written. Also while on the subject 
of female lead movies. Grace may I ask if you remember these two movies: 
Ultraviolet and Aeon Flux; and whether or not if they did well at the box 
office? Or if you even enjoyed these two films to some extent?﻿
top_comment.author: Legusus

comments.text:
+Beyond The Trailer  Well I haven't seen Lucy yet. But Salt was good female 
lead movie. So sad their no plans for a sequal. Hopefully when Marvel green 
light's the Black Widow film they make it like the Bourne films with a 
touch of the Marvel flare.
comments.author: stridin

comments.text:
+Legusus I remember those films and they did NOT do well at the box office, 
but again I feel it's a quality issue.  Lucy I believe so far is the best 
of the bunch, and to some degree Salt.
comments.author: Beyond The Trailer

top_comment.text: do moer like ish﻿
top_comment.author: Caleb Robinson

comments.text: it my b dey
comments.author: Caleb Robinson

comments.text:
whert  do u have to say to  a buffy the vampire robot . or a FRAY THR MOVER 
OR TV SHOWER
comments.author: Caleb Robinson

comments.text: For big enough stories, I will!  Glad you like this new style of video! :)
comments.author: Beyond The Trailer

top_comment.text:
I would rather see a solo Mystique film than see X-Men Apocalypse centered 
around Mystique. That movie should be all about Apocalypse (my favorite 
X-Men villain) and the young versions of Cyclops, Storm, and Jean. However, 
I am not that interested in a Mystique film. I'd rather see Deadpool and 
Cable solo (and maybe a team-up) movie before a mystique movie.﻿
top_comment.author: Joseph Rangel

comments.text:
THANK YOU !!! For pointing that out very clearly. Mystique has always been 
a thorn in the X-men side for years and does not need to be the center for 
future  X-men films.
comments.author: stridin

comments.text: Sam Elliot as Cable.
comments.author: boaman5435

comments.text:
I want a Deadpool solo movie and Cable solo movie first then a kickass 
Cable and Deadpool team up movie.
comments.author: boaman5435

top_comment.text:
i wouldn't want a Mystique centered Apocalypse...they should focus on the 
new team and Apocalypse. i don't think i would like a Mystique solo film 
either...Jennifer got better in her latest portrayal but Romaijne's is 
still the superior Mystique.﻿
top_comment.author: DankyDre420

comments.text:
+Johnny Boy
I like them both equally for different reasons.
JLaw's acting.
RR's sex appeal and how she could tell a story with her body.
comments.author: SHAKHIR2

comments.text:
+SHAKHIR2 Meh that's the reason I like Jennifer Lawrence better than 
Romaijne's Mystique I actually felt more for Mystique's  character than the 
earlier X-Men films.
comments.author: Johnny Boy

comments.text:
I love Romijn Mystique's less talk/more action attitude. Definitely 
revitalized the character.
comments.author: SHAKHIR2
